code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: printf() is used to display output in C.
scanf() can be used to read both strings and integers.
C allows variable names to start with a digit.
answer: C allows variable names to start with a digit.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: main() is the starting point of every C program.
The #include directive is processed by the compiler.
Comments in C can be written using /* ... */.
answer: The #include directive is processed by the compiler.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: In C, char data type is used to store a single character.
The %d format specifier is used for integers in printf.
The float data type is used to store only whole numbers.
answer: The float data type is used to store only whole numbers.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: In C, && is the logical AND operator.
The = operator is used for comparison between two values.
The || operator represents logical OR.
answer: The = operator is used for comparison between two values.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: Array indexing in C starts from 0.
Strings in C are arrays of characters ending with a null character \0.
The size of an array in C can be changed after declaration.
answer: The size of an array in C can be changed after declaration.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: The keyword int declares an integer variable.
C is a case-insensitive language.
Variables must be declared before they are used.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: The sizeof() operator returns the size of a variable in bytes.
break can be used to exit from a loop.
continue ends the program execution immediately.
answer: continue ends the program execution immediately.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: getch() is part of the standard C library <conio.h>.
return 0; in main() indicates successful execution.
printf is a keyword in C.
answer: printf is a keyword in C.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: while loops execute as long as the condition is true.
do-while loops check the condition before executing the body.
for loops can have multiple expressions in their initialization or update part.
answer: do-while loops check the condition before executing the body.
